Andrew Piel

Council Member District 4

Represents the portion of the city bounded primarily by I-20 on the south, portions of Matlock Road, Fielder Road, and Bowen Road on the east, Lake Arlington on the west, and I-30 on the northeast. District 4 includes The Parks at Arlington Mall, a portion of the I-20 business corridor, and the training facilities for the Police and Fire departments.

Andrew was born in Arlington in 1972, and attended both Ditto Elementary and Young Junior High, graduating from Martin High School in 1990. He has been married since 1998 to Anna Evans Piel, and they have two daughters, Elena and Lara.

View Council Districts Map(PDF, 887KB)
(show below)

Andrew began his career as an attorney in 1997 by becoming a member of the Texas State Bar. He first worked as an assistant district attorney in the Tarrant County District Attorney's Office, where he gained extensive jury trial experience. He then transitioned into civil litigation practice in 1999 and has been with his law firm, Harrison Steck, P.C., since 2003, making partner in 2005. Andrew is also a certified mediator. In 2019, he was named a Texas Super Lawyer in Construction Law by Thomson Reuters. He is the former chair and vice chair of the Tarrant County Bar Construction Law Section.

(show below)

  • Past Vice-President - Arlington Education Foundation
  • Member - Young Men for Arlington (1999-2007)
  • Steering Committee Member & Legal Advisor - Murwick Area Neighborhood Association (MANA) Gas Drilling Negotiation Group (2008)

  • Tutor & Volunteer Advisor - HOPE Tutoring (2002-2003)
